Class ImageProcessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • ImageProcessor

  • public class ImageProcessor
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is a picture modifier. It takes a picture, then uses one of its four methods to return an edited picture.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ImageProcessor(Pic picture)
      This constructor creates an ImageProcessor that will modify existing Pics.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Pic add(int increment)
      This method adds a specified integer to the RGBA values of all pixels in a Pic (Bounded by 0 and 255).
      Pic background(Pic bg)
      This method will check all an image's pictures, and if the pixel's alpha value is 0, it will replace that pixel with one from another image.
      Pic chroma(Pixel key, int dr, int dg, int db)
      This method checks whether or not a pixels RGB values are within a range of it's key.
      Pic multiply(double scale)
      This method multiplies a specified double to the RGBA values of all pixels in a Pic (Bounded by 0 and 255).

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • ImageProcessor

        public ImageProcessor(Pic picture)
        This constructor creates an ImageProcessor that will modify existing Pics.
        Parameters:
        picture - ImageProcessor's private Pic value will be initialized to this

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public Pic add(int increment)
        This method adds a specified integer to the RGBA values of all pixels in a Pic (Bounded by 0 and 255).
        Parameters:
        increment - is the number (specified by the user) that will be added to the RGBA values
        Returns:
        a picture that will have its RGBA values modified from the original

      • multiply

        public Pic multiply(double scale)
        This method multiplies a specified double to the RGBA values of all pixels in a Pic (Bounded by 0 and 255).
        Parameters:
        scale - is the double (specified by the user) that will be multiplied to the RGBA values
        Returns:
        a picture that will have its RGBA values modified from the original

      • chroma

        public Pic chroma(Pixel key,
                  int dr,
                  int dg,
                  int db)
        This method checks whether or not a pixels RGB values are within a range of it's key. If this is the case, it will set that pixel's alpha to 0.
        Parameters:
        key - the pixel that thepixel from the original image will be compared to
        dr - the range for the original pixel's Red value
        dg - the range for the original pixel's Green value
        db - the range for the original pixel's Blue value
        Returns:
        a picture that will have its alpha values modified from the original

      • background

        public Pic background(Pic bg)
        This method will check all an image's pictures, and if the pixel's alpha value is 0, it will replace that pixel with one from another image.
        Parameters:
        bg - a Pic that will be used to replace the pixels from the original image
        Returns:
        an image that will have the pixels with an alpha of 0 replaced with pixels from another image
